marketNews.title: S&P500 Records All-Time High Following US GDP Revision
marketNews.content:
The S&P 500 recorded an all-time high at the close on Thursday (28 August) local time, rising +0.32% to 6,502, following the upward revision of U.S. 2Q25 GDP data on the same day. U.S. 2Q25 GDP was revised up by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis to an annualized +3.3% (vs. 1Q25: -0.5% annualized), higher than the consensus expectation of +3.1% and the initial estimate of +3%. On a weekly basis, the S&P 500 gained +2.07%, the U.S. dollar index (DXY) was relatively flat (-0.82%), while the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield fell 12 basis points to 4.2% on Thursday (28 August). This movement followed Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell’s remarks on Friday (22 August) indicating that the central bank may open the possibility of cutting U.S. interest rates at the September 2025 meeting as labor market risk increases. Following the GDP revision, the probability of a September 2025 rate cut remained stable on a weekly basis at about 85% on Friday (29 August), according to the CME FedWatch Tool. Amid the S&P 500 rise, Indonesia’s composite index (IHSG) fell -1.53% to 7,830 on Friday (29 August), driven by negative sentiment from a series of demonstrations since the start of the week.

Key Takeaway: In the near term, the market awaits the U.S. core personal consumption expenditures (PCE) price index to be released on Friday (29 August) local time, the U.S. employment data on Friday (5 September), and the U.S. inflation data on 11 September 2025. These three data points could influence the Fed’s rate decision at the September 16-17, 2025 meeting. Jeff Roach of LPL Financial said that weaker U.S. employment data could dampen the momentum of economic growth from the previous quarter, thereby opening further room for rate cuts.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Should Know
marketNews.content:
1. Bank Indonesia’s Executive Director of the Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department, Erwin Gunawan Hutapea, told Bloomberg that the central bank will maintain rupiah exchange-rate stability through interventions in the spot foreign-exchange market, bonds, domestic and offshore NDFs. His statement came as the rupiah weakened to IDR 16,490 per USD on Friday (29 August), the weakest level since 1 August 2025. Kompas also reported that the government postponed the monthly APBN briefing to 3 September 2025 and delayed the national inflation-control coordination meeting without setting a new schedule.
2. Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) Director Jeffrey Hendrik said on Friday (29 August) that the exchange will implement short-selling transactions starting 29 September 2025. BEI has granted short-selling financing permission to two brokerage members: PT Ajaib Sekuritas Asia and PT Semesta Indovest Sekuritas.
3. The head of the Forest Area Enforcement Task Force (Satgas), Febrie Adriansyah, said the agency plans to regularize illegal mining operations starting 1 September 2025. He estimates the area of illegal mines at 4.27 million hectares. Confiscated mines will be handed over to the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises for temporary management.
4. Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera (NSSS), PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama, sold approximately 174.4 million NSSS shares at an average price of IDR 403.51 per share on 25 August 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 70.4 billion. After the transaction, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama’s direct ownership in NSSS fell from 38.53% to 37.8%.
5. Indomobil Sukses Internasional (IMAS), through its subsidiary PT National Assemblers, signed an agreement to acquire 99.9% of PT Nissan Motor Indonesia from Nissan Motor Co. Ltd., with an undisclosed price. The acquisition aims to improve the group’s business performance by adding a vehicle-assembly portfolio.

tickerNews.title: AADI 1H25 Net Profit Down 50% YoY, Beats Estimates
tickerNews.content: $AADI: Adaro Andalan Indonesia reported net profit of USD 233 million in 2Q25 (+18.7% QoQ, -60% YoY). This result brings 1H25 net profit to USD 429 million (-50.1% YoY), surpassing expectations at 56.7% of the 2025 consensus estimate. Quarterly net profit increased in 2Q25 due to higher revenue (+6.1% QoQ), lower operating expenses (-3.4% QoQ), and a reversal of other losses from a USD 5 million loss in 1Q25 to a USD 28 million gain in 2Q25, raising the net profit margin to 18.8% in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: 16.8%). Operationally, AADI recorded operating profit of USD 292 million in 2Q25 (+0.9% QoQ, +2.5% YoY), resulting in 1H25 operating profit of USD 581 million (-9.5% YoY) and beating expectations (63.7% of the 2025 consensus estimate). The operating profit margin in 2Q25 was 23.6% (vs. 1Q25: 24.8%, 2Q24: 21.2%).

tickerNews.title: BSSR 1H25 Net Profit Down 38% YoY
tickerNews.content: $BSSR: Baramulti Suksessarana reported net profit of USD 30 million in 2Q25 (+54% QoQ, -21% YoY), bringing 1H25 net profit to USD 50 million (-38% YoY). The quarterly net profit increase in 2Q25 was supported by revenue growth (+13% QoQ) that outpaced cost of goods sold growth (+12% QoQ), raising the gross profit margin to 32.7% (vs. 1Q25: 32.3%) and expanding the net profit margin to 17.4% (vs. 1Q25: 12.8%).

tickerNews.title: PTRO Secures IDR 2.5 Trillion Term Loan from BMRI
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrosea obtained a term loan facility of up to IDR 2.5 trillion from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) with an eight-year tenor. The facility will be used to support capital expenditures and strengthen working capital for the development of its engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) business line.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Commissioner Sells ~283 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: Amman Mineral International’s commissioner, Alexander Ramlie, sold approximately 283 million shares of AMMN at an average price of IDR 8,075 per share on 26 August 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 2.3 trillion. After the transaction, Ramlie’s ownership in AMMN fell from 0.536% to 0.145%.

tickerNews.title: HRTA Announces Gold Trade Cooperation with UNTR Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi announced a gold trade cooperation with United Tractors’ subsidiary PT Sumbawa Jutaraya. The transaction value was not disclosed. HRTA explained that the cooperation aims to develop each party’s business activities.
